title: John Bell - Wikispooks
cleaned_text:
Sir John Irving Bell is a Professor of Medicine at Oxford University, and Chairman of the Office for the Strategic Coordination of Health Research. In 1993, he founded the Wellcome Trust Centre for Human Genetics, one of the world’s leading centres for complex trait common disease genetics. He was President of the Academy of Medical Sciences from 2006 to 2011. He was on the Scientific Advisory Board for AstraZeneca from 1997 to 2000 and is a non-executive director of Roche AG (since 2001) and of Genentech (since 2009).[1]

John Bell was appointed to the UK Vaccine Task Force sometime before 1 July 2020.[2] In this capacity he was interviewed by Jon Snow on Britain’s Channel 4 News on August 24, 2020[3] about when the COVID-19 Vaccine would be available. He replied that the vaccines might be available by Autumn, but continued that “These [COVID-19] vaccines are unlikely to completely sterilize a population. They're very likely to have an effect which works in a percentage. Say, 60% or 70%.” Jon Snow look visibly flustered, put his hand over his mouth, interrupted him, but did not ask for clarification.[4]

In a "fact-check" done by AAP in April 2021, he clarified that:[5]
